result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Leverett Fleischmann

defendant.name: Fleischmann, Mark Leverett

records.addlTxt: Commencement date for condition time showing as ordered.

Defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.  Conditions of Probation:
- 10 days condition time with Huber for work.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $500.00; 
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Court stayed commencement until 09/05/2014 at 5:00pm.

Defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer. Karl Hayes for  for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Leverett Fleischmann in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6-10-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
